title: The root of why people hate Yasuo
body:
So the boards are no stranger to Yasuo balance threads, and whether or not they're justified is up to the individual to decide, but I think it's important to address why exactly people hate this champion so much. 

 It because of the anxiety he causes. 

No one wants a Yasuo in their game, you don't want to fight one, and you certainly don't want one on your team. The second one is locked in, the atmosphere of the game is liable to change. If he's on your team you place bets on how long until he reaches 0/10, and if he's on the enemy team you wait for him to pop off. Now there are several champions like this: Lee Sin, Riven, Shaco some fourth guy I'm forgetting about, and I'm not gonna say that there's something special about Yasuo, but I think that the fact that just locking him in can be a source of anxiety to both teams is at least part of the reason why so many people dislike him. 

Personally I've started having an easier time laning against him, primarily because I play a fuckton of Xerath and Yasuo can't windwall most of Xerath's damage, but my general disdain for him has not gone down any less. No matter how easy of a time I may have against him, the fact remains that I don't want him in my League of Legends games. 

This probably isn't new to most people, but I just like the discussion. 


TL;DR: Yasuo is one of the carriers of Shaco Syndrome, and the anxiety that causes leads him to be hated.

EDIT: I sort of generalized by saying that this implies to the entire League community, I mainly meant people who already disliked him, or may have previously fallen victim to this stereotype about Yasuo. If this doesn't apply to you feel free to downvote and be on your merry way.

I just hate him because he counters my entire champ pool. Like if I'm playing Lux, his shield and/or wall will negate most or all of my damage. If I'm playing Kat, his stupid wall blocks literally all of my damage (including ult, passive, Q) except Shunpo even though it's melee range, and I can't poke or burst him through that effing shield. If I'm playing Zyra I can keep his shield off and be a nuisance, but he vaporizes plants with multi-hits and aspd and just windwalls any roots or ulted plants.

He's just a completely cancerous champ that doesn't play by the rules the rest of us have to play by. He's toxic as fuck in lane but still has a great late game. He splits well playing from behind, can get fed easily off ally displacements, hyperscales, and isn't even squishy with the Mallet build and life steal. 

I wouldn't say that he has no weaknesses. I would say that his weaknesses are not pronounced enough for as good as he is overall.

Which suggests that the very existence of Yasuo aversely affects the pool of viable champions for all players.

No, the champions I selected fall in categories, which mean they can be swapped by others in the same category. For example, Annie has a great deal of cc and burst, Kennen has good poke with autos to proc the shield, GP can farm from range with barrels (q CD way lower than windwall), Malz has a suppression, jayce has upfront burst that will dump on Yas etc.

Xerath, Talon, hell even Urgot do well in the matchup. 

Now I ask you which champions are completely shutdown by him.
You sir, should play yasuo 10-15 games, get to know his kit, and you will find it easierto fight him.
Yasuo isn't a feast-or-famine champ though and _shouldn't_ have Shaco syndrome. The only reason that he does is because people try to play him like they're Bjergsen at Worlds and just cock it up.

If anything it's because he's not feast or famine that he causes anxiety. At least with Riven you can pretty much shut her down, but it feels like Yasuo only needs 2 kills to get his core and then people are like, "Fuck, he's relevant now"

Obviously it's not completely true because I've seen shutdown Yasuo's a bunch of times. But the anxiety is still there.

I mean, he trades so well early and his late game is godlike. If he has any amount of lead, then you can expect a dash->auto->Q to just one shot your ass if you're playing any kind of squishy carry.

I would love to see Riot change him up to be more of a "if I don't do what I'm supposed to, then I can't scale". Think about Kindred. If you're not getting your passive stacks, then you're not going to be relevant, no matter how late the game is going. New Rengar is the same deal. These are champions who have to do well early to snowball into a late game lead. If they can't capture that lead early, then it'll be very hard for them to scale into the late game properly.

I think if Riot game Yasuo a mechanic like that and took away the amazing early power out of his Q and passive shield, then he would be a much more interesting champion to play as and against.

She was able to tower dive me and kill me. I was 0/4 and I thought that it was the end of the game for me. Because it should be like that. If someone dominates you in lane you he should be rewarded. But no, Yasuo is not like that. I was at least 50 creeps behind because I started to play very passive, so it was additional advantage for her. How did it end? Well, I got perfect farm 308 cs in 30 min match, I was able to IK enemy ADc, when I was splitpushing I was able to repel enemy ganks or get away alive, because of his mobility and insane deff (I had no tank items, not even frozen malet) We won and I still had only 4 deaths. 

Now you tell me. Yasuo is champion with high skill ceiling, how can someone like me dominate like this after getting stomped so hard? I mean, yeah, I have decent champion pool so I am mechanically good, my game knowledge is also pretty good, map awarness solid, but still, it's super brutal total skillful champion, no? And exactly this is why I hate him. If you are good with him, okay, you deserve to win games. If you are bad with him, heeell no, you shouldn't just get away winning matches if you are put so far behind and you come stronger than anyone just because you got like 20 more creeps and one kill. 
And yep, the thing that your Yasuo is 0/10 and enemy Yasuo is 20/0 is there, too.
